body.p: TokenScript is a framework for JavaScript and XML markup which allows the creator of a token or a trusted authority to declare properties of and rules for the token.

TokenScript enables token creators to leave the restrictions of smart contracts behind. It allows to add a lot of information, even image files or API lookups to a token, and design a set of business rules and interaction logics for it, including attestations and structured interactions with other tokens. Moreover, with TokenScript token issuers can easily and securely update the token rules.

For wallets, TokenScript levels up their capability as the user agent for blockchain interactions. Currently most dApps require a third party website to interprete the state of the blockchain and to craft smart contract transactions. When a wallet imports TokenScript, it is able to fully understand the smart contract, add a lot of information about the token and create all kind of complex transactions. TokenScript eliminates the need for third party websites and puts the user at the helmet.

Web and app developers can import TokenScript into their app. It allows them to securely integrate the full scope of token functionality and to trigger specific token related actions in the user wallet. Without TokenScript they would need to deeply understand blockchain and smart contracts for this. With TokenScript only a very basic knowledge is required.
TokenScript files are signed by the creator of the token smart contract or a trusted source with a public key. Wallets and dApps can import and verify the files.

TokenScript is blockchain agnostic. The main focus of our development is based on Ethereum token. But it can be adopted to other blockchains and even combine token and interactions of different blockchains.

This guide will lead you through the process to set up a TokenScript as a token creator and implement it in a wallet or app. It also provides an overview over the concepts of TokenScript and describes the cryptography it uses and the SDK and libraries we created. You also find some examples how TokenScript improves Tokenization, e. G. for carsharing or for soccer cards.
